intro: Streptoechites, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap, which can be toxic. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. Streptoechites species are native to Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid regions. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
